properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Guns N' Roses concert at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Support acts start from 5.30pm, concert finish around 10.30pm.

With more than 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Corrs concert - Hope Estate - from 4pm Saturday 26 November.

Traffic control with speed limit reductions will be in place at the intersection of Wine Country Drive and Broke Road and the intersection of Wine Country Road and Lovedale Road during the event.

Additional traffic management will be in place on surrounding local roads.

Please follow the direction of traffic control, signage and reduce speed.

Rufus Du Sol concert in the Gardens at the Phillip Precinct in the Domain from 6pm to 11pm Friday 2 and Saturday 3 December.

With thousands of fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to incoming traffic from 7pm both evenings.

Closures will also be in place on the following roads from approx 10pm to allow traffic to leave the event safely. 

  • College St between Park St and St Marys Rd
  • Macquarie Str between Hunter St and St James Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth Str and Macquarie St
  • Prince Albert St between Macquarie St and Art Gallery Rd
  • St Marys Rd between Riley St and Art Gallery Rd
  • Cathedral St from St Marys Rd

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.otherAdvice:
Royal Randwick Christmas Festival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 4:45pm, last race at 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as race goers travel to and from the racecourse. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Christmas at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 11:15am First race at 12:20pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Festival X at Sydney Showground, Sydney Olympic Park. From 11am to 11pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Music fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Sydney Kings v Adelaide36ers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 1:45pm, finish around 6:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Australian Supercross Championship at McDonald Jones Stadium. Gates open from 5pm, start from 6.15pm, finish approx 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
Good Things Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 9pm until 11:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 11am until 11pm on key roads in Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park:

FROM 9PM TO 11:30PM

  • ​​Driver Avenue between ​Lang Road​ and ​the southern turning circle​ (both directions)
  • ​​Lang Road between Anzac Parade and ​Errol Flynn Boulevard (both directions)
  • Lang Road between ​Moore Park Road​ and ​Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Lang Road (westbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Oatley Road and Regent Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Regent Street and Gordon Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)

*Managed access to/from the Entertainment Quarter
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.


FROM 6AM TO 11PM

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street ad City Road (both sides)

FROM 11AM TO 11PM

  • Lang Road​ between ​Anzac Parade​ and ​Cook Road (both sides)
  • Oxford Street between Queen Street and Victoria Avenue (eastbound)
  • Oxford Street between Moore Park Road and George Street (westbound)

FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY 3 DEC TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 4 DEC

  • Driver Avenue between Lang Road and Moore Park Road (both sides)

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Christmas in the City

properties.publicTransport: The nearest transport hubs are Martin Place, Town Hall and QVB. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
City of Sydney Christmas in the City events will be held from 12pm to 9pm on Saturday and 12pm to 6pm on Sunday. Christmas-themed activities will take place in Martin Place and Pitt Street Mall.

On Saturday from 8pm to 9pm, Pitt St will be closed between Hunter St and King St. Motorists will be detoured via Castlereagh St, follow the directions of traffic controllers and allow extra travel time.

Vehicle access to car parks and driveways at Pitt St between Hunter St and King St will be managed by traffic controllers from 7:45pm to 9:15pm.

Traffic may also experience delays on Saturday evening between 7:30pm and 9:30pm while a sleigh travels through the city along Alfred, Pitt, Market and York streets between Circular Quay and Town Hall.

No roads will be closed on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the city over the weekend.

The Olympic Highway (Boorowa St) between Thornhill St and Zouch St will be closed on Saturday 3 December from 6am to 9am for the Young Cherry Festival parade. Diversions will be in place via Dundas St, Thornhill St and Lovell St.

properties.diversions: Detour via Drummond St, Corcoran St and Jerilderie St

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Cowra Christmas Festival will take place on Friday 2 December between 4:00pm and 10:00pm. Kendal Street

(Mid Western Highway) will be closed between Brisbane Street and the Imperial Hotel (east of Lachlan St). Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Motorists will be detoured via Fitzroy Street, Vaux Street and Lachlan Street. The diversion is suitable for all vehicles.

properties.otherAdvice: The Millthorpe Markets will take place at Redmond Oval, Millthorpe on Sunday 4 December between 8:30am and 3:00pm. A reduced speed limit of 40 km/h will be in place on Millthorpe Road (Park St) between Victoria Street and Richards Lane. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.

The annual Warren Christmas Street Party will take place on Dubbo Street at Warren on Friday 2 December between 6:00pm and 9:30pm. The Oxley Highway will be closed between Dubbo Street and Cobb Lane. Motorists should allow additional travel time and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Light vehicles will be detoured via Thornton Avenue, Readford Street and Lawson Street. Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Industrial Access Road.

properties.otherAdvice: West Wyalong Christmas carnival will be held on Friday 25 November from 3pm, finishing around 10pm. The Newell Hwy will be closed between Monash St and Golden St during this time with diversions in place.
properties.diversions: Operator St, Court St, Shire St and Golden St. West Wyalong heavy vehicle bypass remains unaffected.

webLinks.linkText: Orange City Centre Santa Arrival Parade

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Orange City Centre Santa Arrival Parade will take place on Saturday 26 November between 10:00am and 11:00am. Summer St (Mitchell Hwy) will be closed between Anson St and Lords Pl.
properties.diversions: Light vehicle detour: Lords Place / Kite Street or Byng Street / Anson Street. Heavy vehicle detour: Northern Distributor Rd to re-join the Mitchell Hwy.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Country Classic Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 11:45am First race at 12:40pm, last race at 6:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Schools Spectacular at Qudos Bank Arena. Sessions start from 11am each day, finish around 9.15pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the event. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct.
